Title: ğŸ’¬ @PoliticsGR Commentary ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡²ğŸ‡© For me, this is the most polar...
Description: ğŸ’¬ @PoliticsGR CommentaryğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡²ğŸ‡© For me, this is the most polarised election I have seen in years, probably after the US election in 2020. And there are stark differences compared to Moldova.Moldova is led by a pro-European government and since 2022 it has outlawed media perceived to be pro-Russian (Canal 2, Prime), thus stripping the opposition of media voices. This allowed Sandu to accuse Russia of interfering last Sunday in order to influence the result.Georgia, on the other hand, has various types of media, each of them promoting its own narrative. The government ones (Imedi TV, Rustavi 2) are promoting polls by GORBI, which show Georgian Dream at a safe position, while opposition media (Formula TV, Mtavari TV) publish polls that show the opposition being able to govern. This could explain the incidents of violence and attempted vote rigging we saw today.By the way, the electoral commission has yet to publish an official vote count.

Title: ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡º The Central Bank of Russia has raised its interest rate by 2...
Description: ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡º The Central Bank of Russia has raised its interest rate by 200 basis points to 21%, indicating a further rise in December.This is higher than the 20% interest rate following the invasion of Ukraine, even though inflation stands at 8.6%, about half of the rate of early 2022. The rise can be attributed to labour shortages and constant price growth, according to the head of the bank, Elvira Nabiullina. Title: ğŸ‡¿ğŸ‡¦ AfriForum (NGO) and Solidariteit (Trade Union), 2 affiliated...
Description: ğŸ‡¿ğŸ‡¦ AfriForum (NGO) and Solidariteit (Trade Union), 2 affiliated Afrikaans organisations estimated to have some level of participation from the majority of Afrikaans households, called on the DA and VF+ to reconsider their participation in the Government of National Unity if the ANC refuses to compromise over their new proposed educational reform bill.The bill would allow the government to force Afrikaans language schools to teach in other languages. The 2 organisations, which had previously stayed out of politics, said that the bill would deprive Afrikaans children of the rights to education in their mother tongue.Another aspect, although less talked about, is that the bill would lead most predominantly Afrikaans schools to become majority Black, which is likely the reason the ANC proposed the bill.ğŸ“ CapeindependentğŸ—º @PoliticsGR

Description: ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡³ China announced changes in the policies of the real estate market.Big cities in China (Shanghai, Beijing, Guangzhou) decided to loosen up the limitations on purchasing houses.Specifically, Guangzhou announced that it lifted up all limitations (until now, non-permanent residents of the city had to pay taxes or have social insurance of up to 6 months to purchase a house) while in Shanghai the time limit had been reduced from three to one year.After the announcements, the stocks of the construction companies rose. Title: ğŸ” â€¼ï¸âš ï¸ IMPORTANT âš ï¸â€¼ï¸ ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¾ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¾ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¾ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¾ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¾ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¾ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¾ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¾ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¾ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¾ğŸ‡¨...
Description: Forwarded From /GBG/ - Greek Borders General (V)â€¼ï¸âš ï¸ IMPORTANT âš ï¸â€¼ï¸ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¾ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¾ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¾ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¾ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¾ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¾ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¾ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¾ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¾ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¾ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¾ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¾ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¾ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¾ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¾ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¾ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¾ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¾ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¾ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¾ğŸ”´ Cyprus has been successfully curbing mass immigration so far>https://archive.is/U9XFvğŸ”¸ Ever since May 2024, when Cyprus decided to start denying Asylum Applications, there has been an unprecedented reduction of illegal immigrant arrivals, at the same time, the number of deportations and voluntary returns has also increased dramaticallyâ€¼ï¸ According with official data, in 2023 around 11.000 illegal immigrants arrived to Cyprus, most of them from Syria, in 2024, until September 18, the number of illegal immigrants was reduced to 5000. During the same period in 2023, about 8.200 illegal immigrants had already entered CyprusğŸ”¸ The denial of asylum applications from 'Syrians' is not the only measure being taken. Another major factor has been the stronger guarding the maritime and also the land border between Cyprus and the illegally occupied regions of the countryğŸ”¸ Until April and May 2024, the arrivals were 30% more than during the corresponding time in 2023ğŸ”¸ The government has also been cracking down on illegal employment of illegal immigrants, sending the employers to the courts and deporting the illegal immigrantsâ€¼ï¸ So far in 2024, around 1800 people were deported while 5.650 voluntarily returned to their homecountries (with a reward), bringing a total of about 7.400 immigrants leaving Cyprus, a number greater than the 6.900 that left in the same period of 2023âš ï¸ Cyprus is also building a new -pre-removal- immigrant camp for those that have exhausted their legal resources in Cyprus and will be housed there until they are deportedğŸ”¸ Arrivals in 2024 are mostly non-syrians due to denying their Asylum ApplicationsğŸ‘‰ Previous post on Cyprus decision to deny Asylum Applications of all Syrians@GreekBordersGeneral/GBG/ ğŸ—‚
